SourcedStatement: According to Mayor London Breed, the intention is to clean up sidewalks and force unhoused people into the city’s labyrinthine network of shelter and supportive housing programs.
Name: Mayor London Breed
Justification: According to Mayor London Breed, the intention is to clean up sidewalks and force unhoused people into the city’s labyrinthine network of shelter and supportive housing programs.

SourcedStatement: In a response to Gazetteer's questions about potential breaches in protocol, Public Works spokesperson Rachel Gordon only noted that "the policy clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms."
Name: Public Works
Justification: In a response to Gazetteer's questions about potential breaches in protocol, Public Works spokesperson Rachel Gordon only noted that "the policy clearly spells out how soiled items can be handled and our crews follow the policy and consistently apply its terms."

SourcedStatement: Gordon said claims for lost property can be filed with the City Attorney's office.
Name: Public Works
Justification: Gordon said claims for lost property can be filed with the City Attorney's office.

SourcedStatement: Mayor Breed's office did not respond to requests for comment.
Name: Mayor Breed's office
Justification: Mayor Breed's office did not respond to requests for comment.

SourcedStatement: In order to bring public attention to the moral question of sweeps, the Coalition on Homelessness and other unhoused advocates planned to crash an encampment sweep in SoMa last Thursday, which had been scheduled for 12:30 p.m.
Name: the Coalition on Homelessness
Justification: In order to bring public attention to the moral question of sweeps, the Coalition on Homelessness and other unhoused advocates planned to crash an encampment sweep in SoMa last Thursday, which had been scheduled for 12:30 p.m.

SourcedStatement: Robinson’s last encampment was swept about a month ago, and “nearly everything” was taken, including his state ID card, he said.
Name: Antonio Robinson
Title: null
Justification: Robinson’s last encampment was swept about a month ago, and “nearly everything” was taken, including his state ID card, he said.

SourcedStatement: Robinson did not accept it.
Name: Antonio Robinson
Title: null
Justification: Robinson did not accept it.

SourcedStatement: “All they do is tell me to go back to the Hunters Point Navigation Center. And I don’t want to do that. I had bad experiences,” he said.
Name: Antonio Robinson
Title: null
Justification: “All they do is tell me to go back to the Hunters Point Navigation Center. And I don’t want to do that. I had bad experiences,” he said.

SourcedStatement: Joey O’Brien, 46, tried to explain to police officers that he was camping on the sidewalk in Hunters Point while investigating a homicide that occurred while he was in jail.
Name: Joey O’Brien
Title: null
Justification: Joey O’Brien, 46, tried to explain to police officers that he was camping on the sidewalk in Hunters Point while investigating a homicide that occurred while he was in jail.

SourcedStatement: “I don’t understand,” O’Brien kept repeating.
Name: Joey O’Brien
Title: null
Justification: “I don’t understand,” O’Brien kept repeating.

SourcedStatement: O’Brien was polite and contrite, admitting that he had broken several windows in the past while suffering a mental breakdown.
Name: Joey O’Brien
Title: null
Justification: O’Brien was polite and contrite, admitting that he had broken several windows in the past while suffering a mental breakdown.

SourcedStatement: More than anything, however, he begged for officers to bring over his two neat backpacks, which had his best clothes, documents, and “bits of silver.”
Name: Joey O’Brien
Title: null
Justification: More than anything, however, he begged for officers to bring over his two neat backpacks, which had his best clothes, documents, and “bits of silver.”

SourcedStatement: “The other stuff is under all that over there,” the officer said with a shrug. “You’re going to have to pick it up later.”
Name: the officer
Title: null
Justification: “The other stuff is under all that over there,” the officer said with a shrug. “You’re going to have to pick it up later.”

SourcedStatement: “Typically, with city sweeps, they give 72 hours of notice with location and time, and we were following that, but they didn’t follow that usual rule,” Highsmith said.
Name: Julian Highsmith
Title: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Justification: “Typically, with city sweeps, they give 72 hours of notice with location and time, and we were following that, but they didn’t follow that usual rule,” Highsmith said.

SourcedStatement: Highsmith told Gazetteer he believes the city may have gotten wind of the group’s planned sweep disruption and undercut it in order to prevent unhoused people from organizing with their advocates during an enforcement.
Name: Julian Highsmith
Title: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Justification: Highsmith told Gazetteer he believes the city may have gotten wind of the group’s planned sweep disruption and undercut it in order to prevent unhoused people from organizing with their advocates during an enforcement.

SourcedStatement: “I personally think it’s a little suspicious to do the sweep earlier. It doesn’t seem like the city wants attention on the encampment sweeps, and I don’t think they want people to see what happens during that process,” he said.
Name: Julian Highsmith
Title: communications and policy director for the Coalition on Homelessness
Justification: “I personally think it’s a little suspicious to do the sweep earlier. It doesn’t seem like the city wants attention on the encampment sweeps, and I don’t think they want people to see what happens during that process,” he said.

SourcedStatement: “It’s quiet here,” he said.
Name: Antonio Robinson
Title: null
Justification: “It’s quiet here,” he said.

SourcedStatement: According to Public Works policy, staff are supposed to provide the resident of an encampment a “reasonable amount of time (approximately 30 minutes)” to sort through and collect their belongings before the camp is torn down.
Name: Public Works policy
Justification: According to Public Works policy, staff are supposed to provide the resident of an encampment a “reasonable amount of time (approximately 30 minutes)” to sort through and collect their belongings before the camp is torn down.

SourcedStatement: A federal survey released in May counted more than 8,000 unhoused people in the city, which has fewer than 4,000 shelter beds to offer.
Name: federal survey
Justification: A federal survey released in May counted more than 8,000 unhoused people in the city, which has fewer than 4,000 shelter beds to offer.

SourcedStatement: As a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams shows, Public Works has bagged medications, wheelchairs, and even a mobility walker from unhoused people, taking them to the city’s storage facility on Cesar Chavez St.
Name: public records
Justification: As a recent batch of public records secured by City Hall watchdog Hazel Williams shows, Public Works has bagged medications, wheelchairs, and even a mobility walker from unhoused people, taking them to the city’s storage facility on Cesar Chavez St.

SourcedStatement: Dozens of people lined the sidewalks that had been swept just hours prior, fussing with their belongings, setting up new tents, and discreetly selling wares to one another.
Name: people
Justification: Dozens of people lined the sidewalks that had been swept just hours prior, fussing with their belongings, setting up new tents, and discreetly selling wares to one another.
